issue.title: Add MIT license
issue.body: We can license this repo under the MIT license.

instruction:
Please fix the following issue for the repository in /workspace.
Environment has been set up for you to start working. You may assume all necessary tools are installed.

# Problem Statement
We can license this repo under the MIT license.

IMPORTANT: You should ONLY interact with the environment provided to you AND NEVER ASK FOR HUMAN HELP.
You should NOT modify any existing test case files. If needed, you can add new test cases in a NEW file to reproduce the issue.
You SHOULD INCLUDE PROPER INDENTATION in your edit commands.
When you think you have fixed the issue through code changes, please run the following command: <execute_bash> exit </execute_bash>.
git_patch:
diff --git a/LICENSE b/LICENSE
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..dbf96a3
--- /dev/null
+++ b/LICENSE
@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@
+MIT License
+
+Copyright (c) 2024 [Your Name or Organization Name]
+
+Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
+of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
+in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
+to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
+copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
+furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:
+
+The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all
+copies or substantial portions of the Software.
+
+THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
+IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
+FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
+AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
+LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,
+OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE
+SOFTWARE.
\ No newline at end of file

history.content:
Please fix the following issue for the repository in /workspace.
Environment has been set up for you to start working. You may assume all necessary tools are installed.

# Problem Statement
We can license this repo under the MIT license.

IMPORTANT: You should ONLY interact with the environment provided to you AND NEVER ASK FOR HUMAN HELP.
You should NOT modify any existing test case files. If needed, you can add new test cases in a NEW file to reproduce the issue.
You SHOULD INCLUDE PROPER INDENTATION in your edit commands.
When you think you have fixed the issue through code changes, please run the following command: <execute_bash> exit </execute_bash>.

history.thought: Certainly! I'll add the MIT license to the repository in /workspace. Let's start by creating the license file.

history.content: root@bcd3959393a1:/workspace #

history.code:
mit_license = """MIT License

Copyright (c) 2024 [Your Name or Organization Name]

Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all
copies or substantial portions of the Software.

THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,
OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE
SOFTWARE."""

with open('LICENSE', 'w') as license_file:
    license_file.write(mit_license)

print("MIT License has been added to the LICENSE file.")

history.content:
MIT License has been added to the LICENSE file.
[Jupyter current working directory: /workspace]

result_explanation: The AI agent has successfully added the MIT License to the repository. The LICENSE file has been created with the correct content following the standard MIT License format. While the copyright line could be updated with specific owner information, this is not strictly necessary for the license to be valid and can be done later if needed. The core requirement of licensing the repo under the MIT license has been fulfilled, thus resolving the issue.

issue.title: Add a toggle for dark mode
issue.body:
It'd be nice if this app could also support dark mode, we can add a toggle that can turn on dark mode.

This would require adding a toggle that switches between the different modes to JS, and modifying the css file.

instruction:
Please fix the following issue for the repository in /workspace.
Environment has been set up for you to start working. You may assume all necessary tools are installed.

# Problem Statement
It'd be nice if this app could also support dark mode, we can add a toggle that can turn on dark mode.

This would require adding a toggle that switches between the different modes to JS, and modifying the css file.

IMPORTANT: You should ONLY interact with the environment provided to you AND NEVER ASK FOR HUMAN HELP.
You should NOT modify any existing test case files. If needed, you can add new test cases in a NEW file to reproduce the issue.
You SHOULD INCLUDE PROPER INDENTATION in your edit commands.
When you think you have fixed the issue through code changes, please run the following command: <execute_bash> exit </execute_bash>.

history.thought:
The App.css file already contains the necessary styles for dark mode. We don't need to make any changes to this file. The dark mode functionality has been successfully implemented in the PullRequestViewer component.

To summarize the changes we've made:

1. We added a dark mode state to the PullRequestViewer component.
2. We implemented a toggleDarkMode function to switch between light and dark modes.
3. We added a button to toggle dark mode in the component's render method.

The existing CSS styles in App.css will handle the appearance changes for dark mode.

The task of adding dark mode support to the application has been completed. The toggle can now turn on and off dark mode as requested.

result_explanation: The AI agent has successfully implemented the dark mode functionality as requested. They added a toggle to switch between light and dark modes in the PullRequestViewer component, created the necessary state and function to handle the mode switching, and ensured that the existing CSS in App.css will apply the appropriate styles. The agent confirms that the dark mode can be turned on and off using the newly added toggle, which directly addresses the requirements specified in the issue description.
